card.name: Akki Blizzard-Herder
card.ability: When Akki Blizzard-Herder dies, each player sacrifices a land.
card.flavor:
"It remains unclear whether the akki shamans could in fact create storms or simply predicted them."
—The History of Kamigawa

card.name: Akki Raider
card.ability: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Akki Raider gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Akki were very territorial, attacking and destroying any settlements that came too close to their mountain homes. The more successful their raids, the bolder they became.

card.name: Ashen Monstrosity
card.ability:
Haste
Ashen Monstrosity attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: There was a dull thunder at the vanguard, then shocked cries in the midst of the column. Moments later, Takada, last of the rearguard, faced the kami alone.

card.name: Aura Barbs
card.ability: Each enchantment deals 2 damage to its controller, then each Aura attached to a creature deals 2 damage to the creature it's attached to.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : The damage is dealt by the enchantments, not by Aura Barbs.

card.name: Baku Altar
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Baku Altar.
{2}, {T}, Remove a ki counter from Baku Altar: Put a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Bile Urchin
card.ability: Sacrifice Bile Urchin: Target player loses 1 life.
card.flavor:
"The two youths argued and tempers flared. One youth opened his mouth to utter a vile curse, but what he spat out instead was a kami of poison and filth."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

card.name: Blademane Baku
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Blademane Baku.
{1}, Remove X ki counters from Blademane Baku: For each counter removed, Blademane Baku gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Blazing Shoal
card.ability:
You may exile a red card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Blazing Shoal's mana cost.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Blessing of Leeches
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life.
{0}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

card.name: Blinding Powder
card.ability:
Equipped creature has "Unattach Blinding Powder: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to this creature this turn."
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Body of Jukai
card.ability:
Trample
Soulshift 8 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 8 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

card.name: Budoka Pupil
card.ability:
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Budoka Pupil.
At end of turn, if there are two or more ki counters on Budoka Pupil, you may flip it.

———

Ichiga, Who Topples Oaks
Legendary Creature Spirit

Trample
Remove a ki counter from Ichiga, Who Topples Oaks: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
4/3

card.name: Call for Blood
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Call for Blood, sacrifice a creature.
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Uses last known information for the sacrificed creature's power.
2/1/2005 : You may sacrifice the creature chosen as the target for Call for Blood (if you control it) when you pay the additional cost for the spell. If you do, Call for Blood is countered on resolution.
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Callow Jushi
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Callow Jushi.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Callow Jushi, you may flip it.

———

Jaraku the Interloper
Legendary Creature — Spirit

Remove a ki counter from Jaraku the Interloper: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
3/4

card.name: Child of Thorns
card.ability: Sacrifice Child of Thorns: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The soratami scoff at the perils of Jukai, calling the forest an ‘unruly garden.' Perhaps we should send them a rose such as this."
—Dokai, Weaver of Life

card.name: Chisei, Heart of Oceans
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Chisei, Heart of Oceans unless you remove a counter from a permanent you control.

card.name: Clash of Realities
card.ability:
All Spirits have "When this permanent enters the battlefield, you may have it deal 3 damage to target non-Spirit creature."
Non-Spirit creatures have "When this creature enters the battlefield, you may have it deal 3 damage to target Spirit creature."
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Clash of Realities's abilities apply as each creature enters the battlefield and gives them a enters-the-battlefield triggered ability.
2/1/2005 : Creatures with no creature type are non-Spirit creatures.

card.name: Crack the Earth
card.ability: Each player sacrifices a permanent.
card.flavor:
"As the war progressed, the destruction the kami caused became more widespread and less predictable."
—Observations of the Kami War

card.name: Crawling Filth
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Soulshift 5 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 5 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

card.name: Cunning Bandit
card.ability:
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Cunning Bandit.
At end of turn, if there are two or more ki counters on Cunning Bandit, you may flip it.

———

Azamuki, Treachery Incarnate
Legendary Creature Spirit

Remove a ki counter from Azamuki, Treachery Incarnate: Gain control of target creature until end of turn.
5/2

card.name: Day of Destiny
card.ability: Legendary creatures you control get +2/+2.
card.flavor:
"Rise like the sun, stand like the mountain, charge like the lion, die as a hero."
—General Takeno

card.name: Disrupting Shoal
card.ability:
You may exile a blue card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Disrupting Shoal's mana cost.
Counter target spell if its converted mana cost is X.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : Disrupting Shoal can target any spell, but does nothing unless that spell's converted mana cost is X.

card.name: Empty-Shrine Kannushi
card.ability: Empty-Shrine Kannushi has protection from the colors of permanents you control.
card.flavor: "Crease the folds, bend the paper, turn the spirits, shield the soul."

card.name: Enshrined Memories
card.ability: Reveal the top X cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.flavor:
"The race is run in the mind before the first step is taken."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

card.name: Eradicate
card.ability: Exile target nonblack creature. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that creature and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Use the name of the card as it leaves the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : If a copy card is targeted by this effect, you get to look for another copy of the card it is copying. This is because a copy card actually takes on the name and initial characteristics of what it copies.
10/4/2004 : Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.
2/1/2005 : If you manage to turn a land (such as a Forest or Stalking Stones) into a creature, you can indeed use this effect on that basic land type. Eradicate's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
2/1/2005 : The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.
5/1/2012 : A face-down creature has no name, so no card can possibly share a name with it (not even other cards with no name). If you Eradicate a face-down creature you will still search its controller's library, but you won't be able to exile any cards from that library.

card.name: Faithful Squire
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Faithful Squire.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Faithful Squire, you may flip it.

———

Kaiso, Memory of Loyalty
Legendary Creature — Spirit

Flying
Remove a ki counter from Kaiso, Memory of Loyalty: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
3/4

card.name: Final Judgment
card.ability: Exile all creatures.
card.flavor:
"The clashing warriors turned to face O-Kagachi, the greatest kami, and their sigh of awe was their last breath."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

card.name: First Volley
card.ability: First Volley deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to that creature's controller.
card.flavor:
"We searched their bodies for signs of the blades that had killed them, but found nothing more than scorched flesh."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

card.name: Flames of the Blood Hand
card.ability: Flames of the Blood Hand deals 4 damage to target player. The damage can't be prevented. If that player would gain life this turn, that player gains no life instead.
card.flavor: Many ogres extracted blood oaths from the oni they summoned. Others simply extracted blood.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : The damage is unpreventable, and the targeted player's life gain that turn is replaced with nothing.
2/1/2005 : The replacement effect applies only to the target player, not to a creature or player the damage might be redirected to.

card.name: Floodbringer
card.ability:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Tap target land.
card.flavor: "Such a small thing, a drop of water . . . And yet enough of them together can flood a field, cleanse a mire, or choke a forest."
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : The land Floodbringer returns to its owner's hand can be the targeted land.

card.name: Forked-Branch Garami
card.ability: Soulshift 4, soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return up to two target Spirit cards with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Forked-Branch Garami is special in that it has two soulshift abilities. When it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, both soulshift abilities trigger.
2/1/2005 : Each soulshift ability can return one Spirit, or both abilities can attempt to return just one Spirit (causing the second ability to be countered).

card.name: Frost Ogre
card.flavor: Mountain ogres allowed blizzards to sheathe them in ice, both to reinforce their armor and to hide their pungent musk from potential prey.

card.name: Frostling
card.ability: Sacrifice Frostling: Frostling deals 1 damage to target creature.
card.flavor: Its bite will take off more than a toe.

card.name: Fumiko the Lowblood
card.ability:
Fumiko the Lowblood has bushido X, where X is the number of attacking creatures. (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +X/+X until end of turn.)
Creatures your opponents control attack each turn if able.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : X is variable. The bushido bonus is calculated each time Fumiko's bushido trigger resolves, based on the number of attackers at that time.
2/1/2005 : Fumiko's ability doesn't force an opponent to pay for effects in order to be able to attack with his or her creatures (such as Ghostly Prison, for example).
2/1/2005 : Fumiko's ability doesn't force tapped creatures or creatures with summoning sickness to attack.

card.name: Genju of the Cedars
card.ability:
Enchant Forest
{2}: Enchanted Forest becomes a 4/4 green Spirit creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
When enchanted Forest is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Cedars from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Genju of the Falls
card.ability:
Enchant Island
{2}: Enchanted Island becomes a 3/2 blue Spirit creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.
When enchanted Island is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Falls from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Genju of the Fens
card.ability:
Enchant Swamp
{2}: Until end of turn, enchanted Swamp becomes a 2/2 black Spirit creature with "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn." It's still a land.
When enchanted Swamp is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Fens from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Genju of the Fields
card.ability:
Enchant Plains
{2}: Until end of turn, enchanted Plains becomes a 2/5 white Spirit creature with "Whenever this creature deals damage, its controller gains that much life." It's still a land.
When enchanted Plains is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Fields from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling:
8/1/2005 : When activated multiple times, it will have the triggered ability multiple times.  When the animated Plains deals damage, the ability will trigger once for each copy of the ability.  If, for example, you activate the ability three times, the Plains will deal two damage, and you'll gain six life.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Genju of the Realm
card.ability:
Enchant land
{2}: Enchanted land becomes a legendary 8/12 Spirit creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land.
When enchanted land is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Realm from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Genju of the Spires
card.ability:
Enchant Mountain
{2}: Enchanted Mountain becomes a 6/1 red Spirit creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
When enchanted Mountain is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Spires from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Gnarled Mass
card.flavor:
"On the fifty-seventh day of the Battle of Silk, the bell again tolled in hopes of summoning mortal aid. This time, a new breed of kami rose to answer its call."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

card.name: Goblin Cohort
card.ability: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
card.flavor: Akki shells provided good protection when downhill charging became headlong tumbling.

card.name: Gods' Eye, Gate to the Reikai
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
When Gods' Eye, Gate to the Reikai is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Listen at its walls and you will hear the whispers of gods.

card.name: Goryo's Vengeance
card.ability:
Return target legendary creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
Splice onto Arcane {2}{B} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

card.name: Harbinger of Spring
card.ability:
Protection from non-Spirit creatures
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

card.name: Heart of Light
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"There is a shining in the mortal heart that even the kami cannot reach."
—Sensei Golden-Tail

card.name: Heartless Hidetsugu
card.ability: {T}: Heartless Hidetsugu deals damage to each player equal to half that player's life total, rounded down.
card.flavor: Hidetsugu held over a dozen oni in blood oath. At his touch, rocks scorched. At his word, cities burned.

card.name: Heed the Mists
card.ability: Put the top card of your library into your graveyard, then draw cards equal to that card's converted mana cost.
card.flavor: "Once, I looked to the mists for wisdom. Now I wish only for understanding."

card.name: Hero's Demise
card.ability: Destroy target legendary creature.
card.flavor:
"What will it say on our graves, Lord Konda? Will it say we led our world to conquer immortal forces or that we were crushed by our own arrogance? At each defeat, I wonder."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda

card.name: Higure, the Still Wind
card.ability:
Ninjutsu {2}{U}{U} ({2}{U}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Higure, the Still Wind deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a Ninja card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{2}: Target Ninja creature is unblockable this turn.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : If Higure deals regular combat damage and you use its ability to search for another Ninja, that card won't be in your hand in time to activate its ninjutsu ability to put it onto the battlefield and deal damage. However, the card you searched for could still be swapped for an unblocked creature, including Higure, as long as you activate its ninjutsu ability before the end of combat.
2/1/2005 : If Higure deals first strike damage (or the first part of double strike damage), the triggered ability would resolve before regular combat damage, and the searched-for Ninja would be able to get swapped with an unblocked creature and still deal its regular damage.

card.name: Hired Muscle
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Hired Muscle.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Hired Muscle, you may flip it.

———

Scarmaker
Legendary Creature — Spirit

Remove a ki counter from Scarmaker: Target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
4/4

card.name: Hokori, Dust Drinker
card.ability:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land he or she controls.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : If there are two Hokori on the battlefield (for example, if Mirror Gallery is on the battlefield), each player untaps two lands he or she controls at the beginning of his or her upkeep.

card.name: Horobi's Whisper
card.ability:
If you control a Swamp, destroy target nonblack creature.
Splice onto Arcane—Exile four cards from your graveyard. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : Horobi's Whisper can target a creature even if you don't control a Swamp, but the spell does nothing.

card.name: Hundred-Talon Strike
card.ability:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane—Tap an untapped white creature you control. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

card.name: In the Web of War
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"In desperation, Konda sent warriors to parley with the ogre-magi. No one knows whether they were slaughtered at Shinka or if they even reached its bloodstained walls."
—Observations of the Kami War
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : In the Web of War doesn't affect creatures you take control of which are already on the battlefield.

card.name: Indebted Samurai
card.ability:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a Samurai you control dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Indebted Samurai.
card.flavor: "Forgive me, Saburo. I could not save you. But your blade will not rest in my hand."

card.name: Ink-Eyes, Servant of Oni
card.ability:
Ninjutsu {3}{B}{B} ({3}{B}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Ink-Eyes, Servant of Oni deals combat damage to a player, you may put target creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Ink-Eyes.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : If, during the combat damage step, a creature is destroyed during combat and Ink-Eyes also deals combat damage to a player, the destroyed creature can be a legal target for Ink-Eyes's ability.

card.name: Ire of Kaminari
card.ability: Ire of Kaminari deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of Arcane cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor:
"Thunder broke the brittle silence over the Araba. A surge of raw energy lifted the soldier's body into the air and briefly, in the heart of the flash, he saw the face of a god."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

card.name: Isao, Enlightened Bushi
card.ability:
Isao, Enlightened Bushi can't be countered.
Bushido 2 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
{2}: Regenerate target Samurai.
card.flavor:
"I do not care if he claims no allegiance in this war. Find him, Takeno."
—Lord Konda

card.name: Ishi-Ishi, Akki Crackshot
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a Spirit or Arcane spell, Ishi-Ishi, Akki Crackshot deals 2 damage to that player.
card.flavor:
"Here fell Ishi-Ishi, King of the Flaming Pebbles, Scourge of the Mountain Kami, Lover of Goats. May his shell never burn."
—Cave inscription

card.name: Iwamori of the Open Fist
card.ability:
Trample
When Iwamori of the Open Fist enters the battlefield, each opponent may put a legendary creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

card.name: Jetting Glasskite
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Jetting Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time in a turn, counter that spell or ability.
card.flavor: The bolt struck with a flash and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed.

card.name: Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch blocks a creature, return that creature to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
card.flavor: When it's finished, all that's left of you is a ripple on a still pond.

card.name: Kami of False Hope
card.ability: Sacrifice Kami of False Hope: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.flavor:
"Across the rift of battle, a bridge of gossamer. And for one moment, it holds."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

card.name: Kami of Tattered Shoji
card.ability: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of Tattered Shoji gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: It remembered all the shadows lantern-cast upon its paper wings, and sometimes those silhouettes played across its shape again, acting out silent tragedies.

card.name: Kami of the Honored Dead
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Kami of the Honored Dead is dealt damage, you gain that much life.
Soulshift 6 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 6 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

card.name: Kentaro, the Smiling Cat
card.ability:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
You may pay {X} rather than pay the mana cost for Samurai spells you cast, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.
card.flavor: "The bonds of bushido will draw the dishonored back someday, and I will be there waiting."
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Kentaro doesn't change when you can cast Samurai. It just makes Samurai castable for generic mana.
2/1/2005 : Kentaro's ability only applies while Kentaro is on the battlefield. You have to pay for Kentaro normally. It still costs {1}{W}.

card.name: Kira, Great Glass-Spinner
card.ability:
Flying
Creatures you control have "Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time in a turn, counter that spell or ability."
card.flavor: Each spell is an intricate tapestry, and Kira is the great unraveler.

card.name: Kitsune Palliator
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to each creature and each player this turn.
card.flavor: "Who am I to judge who is deserving and who is not? That is a question for lords, not healers."
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : Kitsune Palliator's ability creates prevention shields for every creature and player when it resolves. It doesn't affect creatures that enter the battlefield (or become creatures) later.

card.name: Kodama of the Center Tree
card.ability:
Kodama of the Center Tree's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Spirits you control.
Kodama of the Center Tree has soulshift X, where X is the number of Spirits you control. (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Soulshift is a leaves the battlefield trigger, so the gamestate is referenced immediately before the Soulshift trigger to determine the value of X. Soulshift X includes Kodama of the Center Tree. So, X is always at least 1.
2/1/2005 : Kodama of the Center Tree can return itself to its owner's hand if you control five or more Spirits when it is put into a graveyard from the battlefield.

card.name: Kumano's Blessing
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
If a creature dealt damage by enchanted creature this turn would die, exile it instead.

card.name: Kyoki, Sanity's Eclipse
card.ability: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target opponent exiles a card from his or her hand.
card.flavor:
"Kyoki, Eater of Minds, Corrupter of Thoughts, Bringer of Madness, Lord of Fear. Return, by our blood, and walk again."
—Ogre chant
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Cards exiled by Kyoki's ability are exiled face up.
2/1/2005 : Cards exiled by Kyoki's ability stay exiled even if Kyoki leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Lifegift
card.ability: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Walk the world and you'll find your soul; search your soul and you'll discover the world."
—Diary of Azusa

card.name: Lifespinner
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice three Spirits: Search your library for a legendary Spirit permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"The husk splits like a madman's smile
And mystery steps forth."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

card.name: Loam Dweller
card.ability: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor:
"You know its mood by the plants that spring up around it. When it is placid, fields of lilies flow in its wake; when it is angry, every stem has a thorn."
—Isao, Enlightened Bushi

card.name: Mannichi, the Fevered Dream
card.ability: {1}{R}: Switch each creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Early in his reign, Konda fell ill. His head burned with fever, and he saw visions of his future. In them, he saw a spirit-child, and, in that child's eyes, a way to make his empire last forever."
—The History of Kamigawa
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
4/15/2013 : Switching a creature’s power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

card.name: Mark of Sakiko
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, add that much {G} to your mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end."

card.name: Mark of the Oni
card.ability:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no Demons, sacrifice Mark of the Oni.
card.flavor:
"As more oni walked Kamigawa, more darkness infested its inhabitants' souls."
—The History of Kamigawa

card.name: Matsu-Tribe Sniper
card.ability:
{T}: Matsu-Tribe Sniper deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
Whenever Matsu-Tribe Sniper deals damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

card.name: Mending Hands
card.ability: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor:
"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer

card.name: Minamo Sightbender
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Target creature with power X or less is unblockable this turn.
card.flavor: Woven from threads of the spirit world, the mistcloak rendered its wearer invisible, but quickly fell to tatters.

card.name: Minamo's Meddling
card.ability: Counter target spell. That spell's controller reveals his or her hand, then discards each card with the same name as a card spliced onto that spell.
card.flavor: Like storm water through the segments of bamboo, the spell followed the links of magic. Then it destroyed them.

card.name: Mirror Gallery
card.ability: The "legend rule" doesn't apply.
card.flavor: Only in mirrors do heroes find their equal.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : Mirror Gallery removes the "Legend rule" while it's on the battlefield. If all Mirror Galleries leave the battlefield, the "Legend rule" will apply the next time state-based actions are checked.

card.name: Mistblade Shinobi
card.ability:
Ninjutsu {U} ({U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Mistblade Shinobi deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature that player controls to its owner's hand.

card.name: Moonlit Strider
card.ability:
Sacrifice Moonlit Strider: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

card.name: Neko-Te
card.ability:
Whenever equipped creature deals damage to a creature, tap that creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Neko-Te remains on the battlefield.
Whenever equipped creature deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life.
Equip {2}

card.name: Nezumi Shadow-Watcher
card.ability: Sacrifice Nezumi Shadow-Watcher: Destroy target Ninja.
card.flavor:
"The Okiba Gang Night-cursed thieves and assassins I've had enough of their meddling Triple the guard"
—Marrow-Gnawer

card.name: Ninja of the Deep Hours
card.ability:
Ninjutsu {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Ninja of the Deep Hours deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

card.name: Nourishing Shoal
card.ability:
You may exile a green card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Nourishing Shoal's mana cost.
You gain X life.

card.name: Ogre Marauder
card.ability: Whenever Ogre Marauder attacks, it gains "Ogre Marauder is unblockable" until end of turn unless defending player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor: Once freed, the oni demanded more and more sacrifices to appease them. The ogres happily obliged.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Ogre Marauder's ability requires the defending player to sacrifice a creature as the ability resolves, or Ogre Marauder can't be blocked for the rest of the turn.
2/1/2005 : Attacking with Ogre Marauder a second time would cause a second trigger. If no creature was previously sacrificed, the Marauder already can't be blocked. Sacrificing a creature for the second trigger will not nullify the first.

card.name: Ogre Recluse
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, tap Ogre Recluse.
card.flavor:
"Those ogres who did not embrace oni worship were cast out, cursed, and forced into hermitage, waiting for the day the oni would come for them."
—The History of Kamigawa

card.name: Okiba-Gang Shinobi
card.ability:
Ninjutsu {3}{B} ({3}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Okiba-Gang Shinobi deals combat damage to a player, that player discards two cards.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : If the defending player has two or fewer cards in hand when Okiba-Gang Shinobi deals combat damage to that player, they are all discarded.

card.name: Opal-Eye, Konda's Yojimbo
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage this turn, that damage is dealt to Opal-Eye, Konda's Yojimbo instead.
{1}{W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Opal-Eye this turn.

card.name: Orb of Dreams
card.ability: Permanents enter the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor:
"Behind the eyelids, a flickering flame.
Beneath the dream, a flickering sorrow.
Can peace find you in this sleep
When all the world is tossed by war?"
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

card.name: Ornate Kanzashi
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target opponent exiles the top card of his or her library. You may play that card this turn.
card.flavor: Masako was privy to a great many of Konda's deepest secrets, and her hair was always perfect.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Normal restrictions apply to cards exiled by Ornate Kanzashi (you can't cast an Instant unless you have priority, etc.).
2/1/2005 : Cards exiled by Ornate Kanzashi's ability are exiled face up.
2/1/2005 : You must pay all costs to play cards exiled by Ornate Kanzashi.
2/1/2005 : You can't play cards you exiled with Ornate Kanzashi on previous turns.
2/1/2005 : Cards exiled by Ornate Kanzashi's ability stay exiled even if the Kanzashi leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Overblaze
card.ability:
Each time target permanent would deal damage to a creature or player this turn, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
Splice onto Arcane {2}{R}{R} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

card.name: Oyobi, Who Split the Heavens
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, put a 3/3 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Her angry call split the sky. From that rift descended her champions.

card.name: Patron of the Akki
card.ability:
Goblin offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Goblin and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Goblin. Mana cost includes color.)
Whenever Patron of the Akki attacks, creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Patron of the Kitsune
card.ability:
Fox offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Fox and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Fox. Mana cost includes color.)
Whenever a creature attacks, you may gain 1 life.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : You may gain one life per attacking creature when the ability resolves during each declare attackers step.
2/1/2005 : You may gain life when any creatures are declared as attackers, not just for attacking creatures you control.

card.name: Patron of the Moon
card.ability:
Moonfolk offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Moonfolk and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Moonfolk. Mana cost includes color.)
Flying
{1}: Put up to two land cards from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : You may put zero, one, or two lands onto the battlefield with Patron of the Moon's ability. The number is determined as the ability resolves. You don't need lands in hand to activate the ability.

card.name: Patron of the Nezumi
card.ability:
Rat offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Rat and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Rat. Mana cost includes color.)
Whenever a permanent is put into an opponent's graveyard, that player loses 1 life.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : Patron of the Nezumi's ability triggers even if an event puts this and multiple other permanents into the graveyard at the same time (Wrath of God, gang blocks, etc.)

card.name: Patron of the Orochi
card.ability:
Snake offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Snake and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Snake. Mana cost includes color.)
{T}: Untap all Forests and all green creatures. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Patron of the Orochi's ability untaps nonbasic lands that are also Forests (such as some of the Revised dual lands) and multicolored creatures that are also green.
2/1/2005 : The Patron's ability can be activated only once per turn, even if control of Patron of the Orochi changes.

card.name: Petalmane Baku
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Petalmane Baku.
{1}, Remove X ki counters from Petalmane Baku: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool.

card.name: Phantom Wings
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Sacrifice Phantom Wings: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Many kami could fly, which put some warriors at a distinct disadvantage. The mages of Minamo took it upon themselves to correct that imbalance.

card.name: Psychic Spear
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a Spirit or Arcane card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor:
"The wizards of Takenuma Swamp faced the horrors of humanity every day. It's no wonder they fared so well against the kami."
—Observations of the Kami War

card.name: Pus Kami
card.ability:
{B}, Sacrifice Pus Kami: Destroy target nonblack creature.
Soulshift 6 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 6 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

card.name: Quash
card.ability: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It exiles the countered spell. This is because the first sentence puts the spell into the graveyard before you continue to the second sentence.
10/4/2004 : If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled but all the other copies in the graveyard, hand, and library are exiled.
2/1/2005 : Quash can exile cards even if the spell countered was a copy of a spell. For example, if you Quash a Boomerang cast from an Isochron Scepter, you may search for and exile cards named Boomerang.
2/1/2005 : If Quash counters a spell that has had text spliced onto it, only the base spell may be exiled. For example, if you use Quash to counter a Kodama's Might with a Glacial Ray spliced onto it, you may search for and exile only Kodama's Might.
2/1/2005 : The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

card.name: Quillmane Baku
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Quillmane Baku.
{1}, {T}, Remove X ki counters from Quillmane Baku: Return target creature with converted mana cost X or less to its owner's hand.

card.name: Reduce to Dreams
card.ability: Return all artifacts and enchantments to their owners' hands.
card.flavor:
"This world is a dream. We cling to our toys like children, but sooner or later we must learn to live without them."
—Sensei Hisoka

card.name: Ribbons of the Reikai
card.ability: Draw a card for each Spirit you control.
card.flavor:
"If wisdom is a river, then we cup our hands, reach in, and drink from it in sips. The kami, however, are like fish, swimming, breathing, surrounded in its presence."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

card.name: Roar of Jukai
card.ability:
If you control a Forest, each blocked creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane—An opponent gains 5 life. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : Roar of Jukai can be cast even if you don't control a Forest or there are no blocked creatures. If you control no Forests or if there are no blocked creatures, the spell does nothing.

card.name: Ronin Cliffrider
card.ability:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Ronin Cliffrider attacks, you may have it deal 1 damage to each creature defending player controls.

card.name: Ronin Warclub
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +2/+1.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, attach Ronin Warclub to that creature.
Equip {5} ({5}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : The triggered ability can attach Ronin Warclub to an untargetable creature because the ability doesn't target.
2/1/2005 : The triggered ability won't attach Ronin Warclub to a creature that can't be equipped (such as Goblin Brawler).

card.name: Sakiko, Mother of Summer
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, add that much {G} to your mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end.

card.name: Sakura-Tribe Springcaller
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, add {G} to your mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end.

card.name: Scaled Hulk
card.ability: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Scaled Hulk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Say, what rhymes with ‘run for your lives'?"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet

card.name: Scour
card.ability: Exile target enchantment. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that enchantment and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.
2/1/2005 : Scour can target and exile cards that aren't always enchantments, but are enchantments when Scour is cast and resolves (such as creatures turned into enchantments by Soul Sculptor). Scour's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
2/1/2005 : The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

card.name: Scourge of Numai
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life if you don't control an Ogre.
card.flavor:
"Where a once-proud human city stood, only the ruins of Numai remain, deep amid rotting bamboo and plagued by oni."
—The History of Kamigawa

card.name: Shimmering Glasskite
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Shimmering Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time in a turn, counter that spell or ability.
card.flavor: A child's whisper could crack its shell, but not even an oni's scream could penetrate it.

card.name: Shining Shoal
card.ability:
You may exile a white card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Shining Shoal's mana cost.
The next X damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or creatures you control this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : If the player or creature that was targeted is no longer playing or on the battlefield when the damage would occur, the damage isn't redirected.
2/1/2005 : The redirection protects both you and your creatures from the source. If the source would deal more than X damage to multiple objects, you decide which damage is redirected until X is used up. For example, your opponent casts a spell that deals 1 damage to you and 1 damage to two of your creatures. If you cast Shining Shoal with X = 2, you can have damage to you and one creature redirected to the target, or you could have damage to both creatures redirected.

card.name: Shinka Gatekeeper
card.ability: Whenever Shinka Gatekeeper is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.
card.flavor:
"Understanding is not a virtue of the ogre. Do not seek to reason your way into Shinka Keep."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

card.name: Shirei, Shizo's Caretaker
card.ability: Whenever a creature with power 1 or less is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may return that card to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step if Shirei, Shizo's Caretaker is still on the battlefield.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Shirei's ability only triggers if the creature's power immediately before leaving the battlefield is 1 or less.
2/1/2005 : If Shirei leaves the battlefield and returns to the battlefield after a creature with power 1 or less is put into your graveyard, it won't return that creature to the battlefield under your control.
2/1/2005 : Shirei's ability doesn't affect creatures put into your graveyard before Shirei enters the battlefield. The "if" clause modifies the conditions on which creatures are returned.

card.name: Shizuko, Caller of Autumn
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player adds {G}{G}{G} to his or her mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from that player's mana pool as steps and phases end.

card.name: Shuko
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
Equip {0} ({0}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.flavor:
"One scratch on a wall meant safe passage, two that the target had already been raided, and three warned of a trap."
—Weaponry of Kamigawa
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : You may activate this card's equip ability targeting the creature that it is currently attached to, even if it's the only creature you control. Since the equip ability costs zero, you can do this as many times as you like during your main phases, though it generally won't do anything.

card.name: Shuriken
card.ability:
Equipped creature has "{T}, Unattach Shuriken: Shuriken deals 2 damage to target creature. That creature's controller gains control of Shuriken unless it was unattached from a Ninja."
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Sickening Shoal
card.ability:
You may exile a black card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Sickening Shoal's mana cost.
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

card.name: Silverstorm Samurai
card.ability:
Flash
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

card.name: Skullmane Baku
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Skullmane Baku.
{1}, {T}, Remove X ki counters from Skullmane Baku: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

card.name: Skullsnatcher
card.ability:
Ninjutsu {B} ({B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Skullsnatcher deals combat damage to a player, exile up to two target cards from that player's graveyard.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : Skullsnatcher's ability can target zero, one, or two cards in that player's graveyard.

card.name: Slumbering Tora
card.ability: {2}, Discard a Spirit or Arcane card: Slumbering Tora becomes an X/X Cat artifact creature until end of turn, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Soratami Mindsweeper
card.ability:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Sosuke's Summons
card.ability:
Put two 1/1 green Snake creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Whenever a nontoken Snake enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Sosuke's Summons from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Sowing Salt
card.ability: Exile target nonbasic land. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that land and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.
2/1/2005 : The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

card.name: Splinter
card.ability: Exile target artifact. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that artifact and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.
2/1/2005 : Splinter can target and exile cards that aren't always artifacts, but are artifacts when Splinter is cast and resolves (such as an animated Stalking Stones). Splinter's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
2/1/2005 : The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

card.name: Split-Tail Miko
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: "I wish there were no use for those with my talents. I wish that I could walk Kamigawa forgotten and unneeded, with no war wounds to heal and no broken bones to mend."

card.name: Stir the Grave
card.ability: Return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Your lungs may not draw breath, but while your hands can grip a sword, you will be useful to me."
—Nighteyes, nezumi necromancer

card.name: Stream of Consciousness
card.ability: Target player shuffles up to four target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.
card.flavor:
"All things return to their beginnings. The waters that spill across the Kamitaki Falls flow to sea, only to be returned to her as the rain that joins the mighty river."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Stream of Consciousness can target from zero to four cards.
2/1/2005 : Stream of Consciousness targets the player as well as the cards. The shuffle occurs even if zero cards are targeted.

card.name: Sway of the Stars
card.ability: Each player shuffles his or her hand, graveyard, and permanents he or she owns into his or her library, then draws seven cards. Each player's life total becomes 7.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Changes in life total are treated as life gain and life loss.
2/1/2005 : Tokens are included in the effect but shouldn't actually be included in the shuffle. Tokens will cease to exist immediately after the spell resolves.

card.name: Takeno's Cavalry
card.ability:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Takeno's Cavalry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking Spirit.
card.flavor: At night he perfected his aim, shooting spiderwebs by starlight.

card.name: Takenuma Bleeder
card.ability: Whenever Takenuma Bleeder attacks or blocks, you lose 1 life if you don't control a Demon.
card.flavor: "I prefer to weave my magic through oni blood, but yours will do in a pinch."

card.name: Tallowisp
card.ability: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may search your library for an Aura card with enchant creature, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Isolated on its little candlewick, the kami never heard of the crime that drove its comrades to war.

card.name: Teardrop Kami
card.ability: Sacrifice Teardrop Kami: You may tap or untap target creature.
card.flavor:
"Do not fall into the trap of thinking you understand the kami. Cannot a drop of water be dew on the meadow, a glacier's thaw, or the tear of a child?"
—Sensei Hisoka

card.name: Tendo Ice Bridge
card.ability:
Tendo Ice Bridge enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Tendo Ice Bridge: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Terashi's Grasp
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
card.flavor:
"The jeweler, the potter, the smith . . . They all imbue a bit of their souls into their creations. The kami destroy that crafted mortal shell and absorb the soul within."
—Noboru, master kitemaker

card.name: Terashi's Verdict
card.ability: Destroy target attacking creature with power 3 or less.
card.flavor: It was as though the sky opened its eyes and found what it saw displeasing.

card.name: That Which Was Taken
card.ability:
{4}, {T}: Put a divinity counter on target permanent other than That Which Was Taken.
Each permanent with a divinity counter on it is indestructible.
card.flavor:
"This god held prisoner in human hands has put all humanity in the hands of angry gods."
—Masako the Humorless
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Permanents with divinity counters on them are only indestructible if That Which Was Taken is on the battlefield.
2/1/2005 : The divinity counters created by That Which Was Taken are the same type of counter as those used by the Myojin creatures in the Champions of Kamigawa set.
2/1/2005 : One That Which Was Taken can put divinity counters on another That Which Was Taken (for example, if Mirror Gallery is on the battlefield).

card.name: Threads of Disloyalty
card.ability:
Enchant creature with converted mana cost 2 or less
You control enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"Over time, Konda grew ever more suspicious, fearing even his most loyal allies were being manipulated by unseen hands."
—The History of Kamigawa
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Threads of Disloyalty can't target a creature with converted mana cost 3 or greater. If it somehow enchants a creature with converted mana cost 3 or greater, Threads of Disloyalty is put into the graveyard the next time state-based actions are checked.
2/1/2005 : Creatures on the battlefield treat {X} in their mana cost as 0 for the purposes of calculating converted mana costs.
2/1/2005 : Tokens usually have a converted mana cost of 0.

card.name: Three Tragedies
card.ability: Target player discards three cards.
card.flavor:
"As the kami passed over the village of Mita, the inhabitants relived their three most grievous tragedies. Some cried. Some raged. Some were driven to madness. But the next morning, none possessed the will to fight."
—Observations of the Kami War

card.name: Throat Slitter
card.ability:
Ninjutsu {2}{B} ({2}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Throat Slitter deals combat damage to a player, destroy target nonblack creature that player controls.

card.name: Toils of Night and Day
card.ability: You may tap or untap target permanent, then you may tap or untap another target permanent.
card.flavor:
"The war sent Kamigawa into turmoil. Here it was spring and there winter. For some, time stood still, while for others, moments flashed past like minnows in a pond."
—Observations of the Kami War
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : You must choose two different targets when you cast Toils of Night and Day. The targets are chosen on announcement. The tap or untap choice is made on resolution.

card.name: Tomorrow, Azami's Familiar
card.ability: If you would draw a card, look at the top three cards of your library instead. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Tomorrow's ability makes you look at the top three cards, not draw them. Therefore it won't trigger abilities that trigger when cards are drawn.
2/1/2005 : Having multiple Tomorrows on the battlefield does nothing extra.
2/1/2005 : If you would draw two cards, you look at the top three cards of your library, keep one, and put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order. Then you look at the new top three cards of your library, keep one, and put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
2/1/2005 : If you have fewer than three cards in your library, you keep one and put the rest back. If you have no cards in your library, you do nothing.
2/1/2005 : Since Tomorrow replaces all your card drawing with looking at cards, you can't lose the game by being required to draw more cards than are in your library with Tomorrow on the battlefield.

card.name: Torrent of Stone
card.ability:
Torrent of Stone deals 4 damage to target creature.
Splice onto Arcane—Sacrifice two Mountains. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : Nonbasic lands that have the land type "Mountain" (such as some of the Revised dual lands) can be sacrificed to pay for Torrent of Stone's splice onto Arcane ability.

card.name: Toshiro Umezawa
card.ability:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may cast target instant card from your graveyard. If that card would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead.
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : You must still pay the mana cost of the target Instant in your graveyard to cast it using Toshiro's ability.
1/1/2011 : Creatures destroyed by an instant that you cast normally can cause a trigger that allows the instant to be cast again. For example, cast Terror on an opponent's creature. The creature is destroyed, triggering Toshiro's ability, and then the Terror is put into your graveyard. You can put Toshiro's ability on the stack targeting the Terror and then recast it when the ability resolves.

card.name: Traproot Kami
card.ability:
Defender; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Traproot Kami's toughness is equal to the number of Forests on the battlefield.

card.name: Twist Allegiance
card.ability: You and target opponent each gain control of all creatures the other controls until end of turn. Untap those creatures. Those creatures gain haste until end of turn.

card.name: Umezawa's Jitte
card.ability:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage, put two charge counters on Umezawa's Jitte.
Remove a charge counter from Umezawa's Jitte: Choose one —Equipped creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn; or target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn; or you gain 2 life.
Equip {2}
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Umezawa's Jitte's activated ability generates a modal choice. The choice is made when the ability is activated.
2/1/2005 : If the "target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn" mode is chosen, the target creature must also be announced.
2/1/2005 : The ability can be used any time Umezawa's Jitte's controller has priority -- only the "target creature" choice has additional requirements. Choosing the "Equipped creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn" mode does nothing if the Jitte isn't equipped to a creature when the ability resolves.
2/1/2005 : If the Jitte is moved after the "+2/+2" mode is announced but before it resolves, the bonus is given to the creature that is equipped when the ability resolves.
2/1/2005 : If the Jitte leaves the battlefield after the "+2/+2" mode is announced but before it resolves, the bonus is given to the creature that was most recently equipped once the ability resolves.

card.name: Unchecked Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn. If it's a Spirit, it gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"That energy was once granted to growing things. Now the kami keep it for themselves, releasing it in sudden floods that overwhelm flesh and foliage alike."
—Sakiko, Mother of Summer

card.name: Uproot
card.ability: Put target land on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor:
"We arrived at the battlefield too late. Again. Another error on your part, and you will have to answer to me personally."
—General Takeno, letter to the imperial mapmaker

card.name: Veil of Secrecy
card.ability:
Target creature gains shroud until end of turn and is unblockable this turn.
Splice onto Arcane—Return a blue creature you control to its owner's hand. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

card.name: Vital Surge
card.ability:
You gain 3 life.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{G} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

card.name: Walker of Secret Ways
card.ability:
Ninjutsu {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Walker of Secret Ways deals combat damage to a player, look at that player's hand.
{1}{U}: Return target Ninja you control to its owner's hand. Activate this ability only during your turn.

card.name: Ward of Piety
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.
card.flavor: Reluctant to strike at the kami directly, some kitsune trained in more passive fighting techniques.
card.ruling: 2/1/2005 : Redirected damage retains its information. For example, your opponent attacks you with Slith Firewalker (which reads, in part, "Whenever Slith Firewalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.") and you block with a creature enchanted with Ward of Piety. If you activate Ward of Piety, targeting your opponent, the Slith's ability triggers during the combat damage step and it gets a +1/+1 counter. It's still combat damage.

card.name: Waxmane Baku
card.ability:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Waxmane Baku.
{1}, Remove X ki counters from Waxmane Baku: Tap X target creatures.

card.name: Yomiji, Who Bars the Way
card.ability: Whenever a legendary permanent other than Yomiji, Who Bars the Way is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"As I died, I rejoiced. I would see my family again. But then I woke up back on the battlefield. Back in Kamigawa. Back in hell."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted
card.ruling:
2/1/2005 : Yomiji's ability triggers whenever any Legendary permanent is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, not just Legendary creatures.
2/1/2005 : Yomiji's ability triggers even if Yomiji is going to the graveyard at the same time as the other Legendary permanent.

card.name: Yukora, the Prisoner
card.ability: When Yukora, the Prisoner leaves the battlefield, sacrifice all non-Ogre creatures you control.
card.flavor: It took ninety-nine monks to weave the spell that trapped Yukora. Upon the death of the ninety-nine, the spell was broken, and the demon returned to the mortal world seeking vengeance for its imprisonment.
